meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a deer.
meanings.sent1: The elaphine creature moved gracefully through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The elaphine features of the animal made it blend in with the woodland surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The elaphine deer tried to tiptoe like a ballerina, but ended up stumbling comically.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as elegant and swift as an elaphine doe leaping over fallen logs.
meanings.sent5: The forest was alive with the beauty of elaphine creatures roaming freely.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of the family Cervidae, which includes deer.
meanings.sent1: The elaphine family of animals includes majestic deer and graceful reindeer.
meanings.sent2: In the zoo, visitors marveled at the elaphine creatures peacefully grazing in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The elaphine characteristics of the deer made them stand out among the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The elaphine bond between the deer and their young was heartwarming to witness.
meanings.sent5: The elaphine beauty of the deer family captivated all who beheld them.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of an elk.
meanings.sent1: The elaphine antlers of the elk were truly impressive in size.
meanings.sent2: Hunters admired the elaphine strength and agility of the elk in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The elaphine elk strutted proudly through the meadow, showing off its massive antlers.
meanings.sent4: The elaphine grace of the elk as it bounded across the clearing was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The elaphine majesty of the elk in its natural habitat was a symbol of the wilderness's power.
